intro: Conyza lactucifolia, commonly known as common horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has hairy stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by fluffy, white seeds that are easily dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Conyza lactucifolia is known for its adaptability and can sometimes become a weed in agricultural settings.
